intro: Phormium tenax f. atropurpureum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or purple flax, is a cultivar of the Phormium genus native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its striking, dark purple to reddish-brown leaves that are stiff and sword-shaped. The plant is a perennial, evergreen shrub that thrives in full sun to partial shade and is highly drought-tolerant. Its foliage is used in traditional Māori weaving and for ornamental purposes in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and is adaptable to a variety of climates.
